tei:elementSpec.tei:desc: This element is used to switch between styles which are defined in the global or local header environment via styleDef elements.

tei:attDef.tei:desc: This attribute should be used to refer to an articulationDef.

tei:remarks.tei:p: This attribute is optional and meaningful only within an articulationMap.

tei:exemplum.tei:p: Switching the style reference in maps is generally done by placing the style element within the map.
Switching the style reference in an articulationMap is a special case. Here an optional further attribute is available, defaultArticulation.
The default articulation refers to the articulationDef that should be applied to every note that is not articulated otherwise.

tei:remarks.tei:p: If the performance instructions in a map rely on a style definition, the style switch must be placed in the map before the first such instruction, typically right at the beginning at date 0.0.
